subject: Re: [junit] Re: Class not found
msgSnippet: Nope, because I also tried installing under c: junit3.8.1 and it did not work either so it not a space problem definitely. Thanks for your help though!
messageBody:
Nope, because I also tried installing under c:\junit3.8.1 and it did not work either so it not a space problem definitely. Thanks for your help though!
"macewja <jmacewan@...>" <jmacewan@...> wrote:The space is definitely the problem.
Try this old standby (8 character name)
To be sure of the path name it wants, go to a command window and try
to do a DIR where you think the junit.jar is. I think you will find
Dir c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar will give file not found.
Dir "c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar" will be ok, but
classpath probably dosen't like it
Dir c:\Progra~1\junit3.8.1\junit.jar will be ok and classpath will
be happy.

CLASSPATH=c:\Progra~1\junit3.8.1\junit.jar


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "adnan_atique <adnan_atique@y...>"
<adnan_atique@y...> wrote:
> I am receiving a message called "Class not found" after running
the
> following command:
>
> c:\>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
>
> I also made sure that my CLASSPATH is set properly as:
> CLASSPATH=c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
>
> whereas my "junit.jar" file is installed into the following
directory:
>
> c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
>
> Any idea?
> Thanks in advance
